definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: Such youth and prettiness reacted upon him more subtly than wine.
sentences.chinese: 如此青春的美色，比醇酒更令他沉醉入迷。

sentences.english: Indulge in the supreme treat of rich cream and morsels of macapuno.
sentences.chinese: 该冰淇淋让人沉醉于浓郁的奶香和点点椰肉间。

sentences.english: I was carried away by the relief joy that spread across the country.
sentences.chinese: 我沉醉于全国宽怀和欢乐的气氛中。

sentences.english: Have withstood lonely to test new Map Hacks.
sentences.chinese: 故，其姿常独自沉醉于测试新全图之中。

sentences.english: We passed that summer lost in love beneath the lemon tree.
sentences.chinese: 我们在柠檬树下度过整个夏天，沉醉在我们的爱。

sentences.english: Plain Maple has an eternal charm to intoxicate us.
sentences.chinese: 清枫有一种恒久的魅力，足以让我们为之沉醉。

sentences.english: Just get lost in their world.
sentences.chinese: 我沉醉在他们的世界里。

sentences.english: Morgan is involved in extreme skateboarding.
sentences.chinese: 摩根则沉醉于极限滑板运动。

sentences.english: I always enjoy going to sexuality conferences.
sentences.chinese: 我常常沉醉于有关性爱的讨论会。

sentences.english: Drunk in the exultation of kissing her high heel toes.
sentences.chinese: 曾经沉醉于轻吻爱情的高跟鞋尖。

sentences.english: Maximilian, in his devotedness , gazed silently at her.
sentences.chinese: 沉醉在爱情中的马西米兰默默地注视着她。

sentences.english: Loose Melody of Yuan Dynasty reflected their indulgent enjoyment and topmost life experiences.
sentences.chinese: 《全元散曲》反映了他们的沉醉的生活与巅峰体验。

sentences.english: Fall upon a world title intoxicated, mediated by rain.
sentences.chinese: 秋安沉醉，嚬倚一世衔雨。

sentences.english: As a licenced architect, I devote myself to my career and enjoy it.
sentences.chinese: 作为一位建筑师，我奉献并沉醉于自己的事业。

sentences.english: Beautiful dream has been intoxicating, love you, the only you.
sentences.chinese: 美丽的梦一直让人沉醉，爱你，唯你。

definition: to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
to wander about unhurriedly/to linger/to loiter
to indulge in/to wallow/absorbed in/deeply engrossed/addicted
to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth/also written 如癡如醉|如痴如醉[ru2 chi1 ru2 zui4]
deeply immersed/fig. wallowing in/deeply engrossed in
